Reviews.Title: “Cheap and basic”
Reviews.Author: MikeC_2006
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap hotel close to Paddington, and the Palace Court ticked both boxes. It's a budget hotel in every way - cheap, and really not very nice. Felt like more like a hostel than a hotel. My single room was small, basic, had a grubby carpet, bars on the window, and a view over a filthy little basement courtyard. But on the positive side, the shower was very good. Everything felt just a bit grubby. The only hotel I've ever stayed where there was no shampoo or shower gel provided. Perhaps just about acceptable given the low price (for London anyway) - but reception didn't even have any for sale, so it was fortunate that there was a Sainsbury's Local just up the road! The breakfast room was particularly unpleasant - a windowless basement room, with very basic canteen-type furniture, and a very basic contintental breakfast buffet. Strange that there were cups but no saucers (just mugs would have been better!). No bar or lounge. So in summary, it's ok if you need a cheap hotel close to Paddington/Bayswater - but be prepared for a "hostel" type experience.

Reviews.Title: “Endurance Test”
Reviews.Author: SueManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying at this hotel for five nights last week. My room was no bigger than the width of two single beds. I had to leave my suitcase in the bathroom. There was a draft through the window next to my bed and the noise was terrible. There was a glass panel at the top of my bedroom wall, so the room was light all the time. The TV was minute and I couldnt watch the tv in bed as it was like watching a negative, so I had to sit up causing backache. I complained about the draft and was told I would have to pay an extra £60 to move to another room. Having started a new job in London, I was left feeling exhausted and stressed. It would more like an endurance test than a restful experience. I feel as though they should have paid me for staying there, not the other way round. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “not even value for money”
Reviews.Author: matthew p
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 nights could not stand another night. People were nice and that basically it. walls were paper thin furniture was 1980 cheap mfi crap. head board broken mirror broken bathroom stunk had a saniflow system that winas so noisy when another room used theres it sounded like a masonery drill. continenta l breakfast was fine. The room rate advertised for this hotel on late rooms is normally 250 pound. They must be joking. it was not expensive but I have stayed in much better places for the same amount of money... They decor is dated and walls heavly marked. It was however clean I will give them that

Reviews.Title: “Excellent use of space”
Reviews.Author: HarryLerwill
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel a few minutes walk from Notting Hill Gate tube station. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly. There were four of us in a quad room and we were impressed with the use of space. A pair of twin beds adorned the room, with stairs up to a balcony with a double bed. Perfect for what we needed. The place was quiet,clean and well appointed. i liked it and will try and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hygiene forsaken wasteland!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peta28
Reviews.Content: The staff are rude and LAZY and could not care less. Can not emphasise enough how slack people are in this place....they should be embarrassed!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would rather sleep rough.”
Reviews.Author: dmbassy
Reviews.Content: Received a less than friendly welcome after arriving 30 minutes early to check in. My room was pokey. Very pokey. Cleanliness wasn't great either; found a very ling hair in the sink, and another hair in my tea cup. The bed was bumpy and very uncomfortable. There was a small tv in the room, but bizarrely could only pick up bbc news channel 5 and qvc. Breakfast was included in the price of the room, but I opted out of that, as I wasn't told where it was or what time, and after the hairs in my room, I thought it would be better to eat out. The only saving grace for this hotel is it's location in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Flea Bag Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCda2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite in this Hotel on a recent trip to London. Hotel was terrible by North American Standards. No toiletries, stained carpets, paint peeling off the walls, holes in the walls, cheap fiberboard furniture, cigarette burns in the bed sheets. Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. Would have rather slept in the rental car. Save your money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be closed down. I would not even call it a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ralf2211
Reviews.Content: Avoid this dump: By the way the staff lie and should not be trusted especially the guy called Shawn. The room given to me was nothing like the room as advertised. - The room I was given was dirty and cramped with one single bed and a double bed in a tiny loft - The double bed had 2.5 feet headroom and was like a student bedset - There was no wardrobe or hangers in the roomto hang my suit. On the website it says that the hotel is for business and leisure travellers. - There were no towels in the room - There was no telephone in the room when this was advertised - The beds had bed bugs and I was bitten by these bugs during the night. - The outside of the bathroom door was filthy - The window was insecure and led to a common balcony so I could not leave it open during the night - The member of staff on duty in the evening said he had no authority to hear my complaints and he could not even speak fluent English - The next morning the manager Shawn lied to me when i demanded a refund and said that Booking.com who I booked it through had billed me, not the hotel, when clearly the hotel had billed me. When I rang Booking.com the customer service staff member said that the hotel had billed me, not Booking.com. This place should be shut down and the staff disbarred from ever working in the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!”
Reviews.Author: 33388Jim
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel at any price that I have stayed in (and I've made more than a dozen trips to the U.K) in the last 10 years. Furniture and beds a disgrace; carpets stained and dirty - halls narrow (this has to be a fire hazard)..Street noise plentiful....Have stayed in better hostels -- but this cost me 110GBP....Amazing... Only good thing was getting out and going to interesting restaurants in Bayswater..

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: TheDane59
Reviews.Content: Worst B&B, I have ever experienced for the money we paid. Didnt even serve orange juice for breakfast, instead they served a horrible watered down artificially flavored something that was undrinkable - everything so cheap that it was lousy. Staff did not understand english or could not care less. DO NOT STAY at this hotel - you should be able to do much better elsewhere for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug and evidence of rodents......do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: wetnosewheatie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on business - the bed was full of creepy crawlies. There were mouse traps in the rooms. Worst hotel I have ever been in!

Reviews.Title: “Our memory of London will be the terrible Palace Court "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: patrik2521
Reviews.Content: We were picked up in Heathrow T3 by hotel transportation, a car without AC. The driver tried to charge us 50Â£ instead of the 35Â£ i promised on their homepage. We settled on 45Â£ because i had no written confirmation for 35Â£. The room booked was 3 beds for 3 adults Â£ 434 /4 nights, the room we got had 1 single bed and 1 slightly larger single bed, claimed to be a doubble bed. Way too small for 2 Swedish adults. Homepage of the hotel claims "The Palace Court Hotel is a newly refurbished thirty eight bedroom hotel"!? I guess you can call it refurbished in Pakistan or India but in Europe we call it a filth infested dump not fit for humans !!! The furniture was the kind you find in a rubbish dump. The carpet was probably coming from a stable. The curtains was stained with dirt. Ventilation non existing. One morning it was dripping water from the lamp in the toilet. Everyday only 2 towels and no soap or shampoo. The employe working Saturday 4/6 evening refused to bring a towel to the room "we do not have room service" was he's reply. We tried the breakfast 1 day but the dirt covering the rest of the "hotel" told us too stay away from eating inside the building. I travel 200 days/year all over the world. The mentality of the personel working in this hotel cannot be found elsewhere. Guest houses i visited in India has the same cleanliness (non existing) as this so called "hotel". It's sad to see that the English goverment allows people with no clue regarding health, vermin, germs and hospitallity are allowed to manage "hotels". It's not good PR for England when these kind of people ripping tourists of ther money. We will probably not come back to London again. And if you read the rewiews on internet regarding this "hotel" peple will only stay one time and NEVER again. Close all these filth infested dumps down if you want to keep your tourists!!!

Reviews.Title: “Completely over prized and no service”
Reviews.Author: BirgitteNielsen
Reviews.Content: We are so sorry, that we did not read the reviews before our stay at this over prized and awful hotel. We have stayed at many different hotels all over the world - and this is the first time that we have experienced such a bad hotel at a quite expensive rate. Also, the service was absolutely non-existing. We reported several problems to the staff, but everyone just pushed the responsibility to the next one. The hotel should be closed - DONÂ´T stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Revolting rooms, service and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: onehumanunit
Reviews.Content: I have been given a room measuring 2m x 3m covered in ageing linen, dirty basin and broken mirror. To get to the room I had to descend into the basement and climb over big blue bags with the hotel's spare linen. I've been lured into booking this hotel because of the low rate, but have been staying in several hotels at the same rate that are considerably more presentable. I had to endure three prepaid nights here, and not once had my towel been changed or towel changed. Reception is unhelpful to say the least. I stay in a different hotel every week, and have never been so moved as to actually write a review. This hotel should be reported to the authorities.

Reviews.Title: “not always the stars show that what it really is...”
Reviews.Author: SamiyaA
Reviews.Content: clean, comfortable, good staff for two-star hotel. very convenient location P.S. just a little choice for breakfast :))

Reviews.Title: “Rat poison for breakfast, sir?”
Reviews.Author: Riotstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night on a business trip, thinking it would be reasonably cheap and well placed. The location was fine, felt fairly safe but not very attractive area. Bedsit city, really! The hotel was basic, as expected, but I didn't sleep well as the mattress appeared to have collapsed. There was rat poison in the corner of the breakfast room, which was rather off putting! The bread for toast was frozen, there was just watered down lemon or blackcurrant squash and no juice and instant coffee.The bran flakes dispenser was broken meaning it was cornflakes or muesli or nothing! There are so many budget hotels in this area that I would recommend you look eslewhere as there must be better ones than this!

Reviews.Title: “OMG I honestly expected to see Kate Adie”
Reviews.Author: lonelyjohn
Reviews.Content: Where on earth do we start. Upon arrival we were greeted by what can only be discribed as a character from Shameless, it was at this point looking back we really feel we should have left. However we didn't :-( We were shown to our "holding pen" and due to the lack of space we had to place our bags on the desk that immediatley crumbled under the slight weight. My partner decided to check out the bathroom only to discover a scene not unlike those published of the competitors accomadation for the Indian commonwealth games...infact maybe this is where they got their inspiration. Whilst standing in the shower I noticed rather a fine gourmet selection of fungi sprouting from the bottom of the shower tray and finally the mirror on the wall was obviously taken from the wing mirror of a Ford Escort. The object which took up most of the room (we think this was supposed to be a bed) was similar to the work top in our kitchen at home after leaving the children alone for an hour - covered in various inexplicable stains. The room had a very curious odur which was still evident on ourselves long after departure. After returning from a rather long day of sightseeing we were greeted by a member of the avian family...a sparrow. This little fella appeared to have got in through the minute gap in the window that we left ajar to try and erradicate the foremetioned stench. However upon realising that it would be by far better off in the outside world, the little bird made a break for freedom. After complaining to several members of staff regarding the disgusting hovel of a room, we were met with the same reply - "You knew what you were getting when you booked it" Marvellous. This was a make or break trip for our struggling relationship. We now have divorce proceedings underway. Cereal wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brussels_1030
Reviews.Content: Stay await from this hotel! It should be closed asap by UK authorities... I have stayed a dozen of times in London for business trips but in January 2010, all the hotels I usually stay in the Bayswater area were unexpectedly full or expensive. To my greatest regret I picked the Palace Court Hotel in a hurry, through a combined Eurostar train+ hotel booking. The hotel was dreadful, the tinest rooms ever (6m2 tops, bathroom included). There were BED BUGS (I got three bites on my arm!)...In one word: a nightmare for the hostelling sector. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Several awful conditions, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Attentiontodetails
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palace Court Hotel in the midst of the snow chaos in the days before the christmas of 2010. Unfortunately the London hotels were overflooded by delayed travellers like myself and so this was the only hotel I found to be available online. I have stayed in severa hotels in the bayswater area before but I have never come across something as repulsing as this hotel. First of all I had problems fitting myself into the single room. There was no chair to sit on, only a tiny bed surrounded by shelves so nowhere to lean and relax without laying down on the hard bed. The toilet made a lot of noice when used and I barely fit in under the shower. The oven did not warm the room up to an acceptable degree and I was left freezing, in turn giving me a cold when I returned back home. The walls of the room were so thin that I could hear the neighbours getting it on. BUT MOST DISTURBINGLY, as I was watched a movie on my computer (which I had to as the TV did not work) a MOUSE came into the room. Desperate for some sleep I just chased it out into the hall and filled every crack of the room with paper towels so that nothing could enter. When I told the lazy man in the reception about it the morning after, I was not even given an apology, just a nodd as if that happened often. With that taken into consideration I did not even try the breakfast. NEVER AGAIN PALACE COURT HOTEL. In fact I'm going to stay away from that whole building from now on. Hope these people go bankrupt so that someone serious can give the place the refurbishment it needs. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: AHazeb
Reviews.Content: The website and the pictures are misleading this is a nasty place the room was very small you could not turn a cat in it ,on the 4th floor and with no lift . Reception !! well the worst i have seing in over 30 years in the travel business very rude intimidating and insulting ...Shwan was on his mobile and had no clue how to talk to customers he is antipathetic and very rude, was on a very long call on his mobile while he was supposedly dealing with me .... The hotel management did not care about customer service they feel they are in a good location and with a pretty website they will get panters .. they opted for covering up their short falls Avoid this place, you get a better value for money if you try else where .

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly misleading and over priced for the horrible room”
Reviews.Author: abbyroad1011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we knew the area. The price was absurd for the room that we got. We stayed right in central Dublin during the days prior and paid less and stayed in one of the nicest hotels we'd been in during out 6 weeks in Europe. We got to the room and it was small and dirty and smelled horrible. The shower was disgusting. I would never suggest anyone stay at this hotel. We left and found a new hotel. Do not stay in this hotel. Their web site was the most misleading. And the newly renovated hotel was clearly still being renovated with all of the crap that was sprawled throughout the hall way.

Reviews.Title: “Its not that bad, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Delza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend as I booked a theater show for the night and made sense to in london as we both don't live in london. The price was satisfactory and surprisingly cheap compared to other hotels within there standard. As I booked it directly from there website (Not lastmin, Late Rooms, Room reservation etc. Booking directly can be cheaper than price comparison websites) I did not realise so many people left BAD comments especially about BED BUGS!! By this time i had already booked it . But lucky the bed were clean, new in-fact and changed everyday. Our view was good over looking a private park!! Breakfast ok. So on the whole a nice stay. If you you staying with friends here it may not be as good. Maybe the rooms are better for couples, also this area (Baywater) has a lot of youth hostels so thats why they are not appealing to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: lovinlava
Reviews.Content: Where to start?? Reservation mess-up. No apologies from staff. Noisy neighborhood at night. Dirty room--I wiped down the wall myself because it was so disgusting. Rude staff. Internet access was a joke. Description we read on booking.com said it was newly remodeled. WHEN? Luckily we only stayed two nights. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: saskia13
Reviews.Content: we never got any bites as on arrival we went an got a heavy duty plastic dust sheet to put on the broken staind bed .we checked in at one oclock dragged our bags up to the top floor to be meet by oh my god a bed that was broken an had brown stains all over it the walls were dirty the carpet was dirty an had someones toe nails on it the bathroom was like a very used public toilet the shower had brown mold .when i asked the front desk if this room had been cleaned she said she had made a mistake an to leave our bags an she would have it cleaned we returned later with heavey heart an a plastic dust sheet to find the room in the same state nothing had been done .we went back down stairs to where the manager was an got him up to see the room .humm rose coloured specs although it was ok for us to stay in his dirty filthy hotel when asked if he would put up with this his answer was no poor poor poor motel please dont go anywhere near this place dirty dirty dirty dirty place

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Zutz
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation for the weekend of the volcan issue (April 16th) and obviously my flight was cancelled. I didn't have enough time (48h as stablished for the most of the hotels) to cancel my reservation and they charged 100% of the stay at the hotel. It was no way no reach a mutual agreement for both parts... I do not recomend this hotel to anybody. This weekend, I went to London and I stayed in another one...

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Liliana83
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel before reading the many negative reviews and were extremely concerned once we had read them. We found the service very friendly and the general cleanliness great. What must be taken into consideration is that this hotel is exactly what it says it is - a budget hotel. As such, to expect fancy frills etc is unrealistic. It serves its purpose and is clean. The breakfast was fresh and the dining and kitchen areas spotless. The hotel is situated conveniently near to two underground stations making access to the city a pleasure. We certainly recommend this as a great place for a London stop over.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely awful !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ange1979
Reviews.Content: this hotel was awful to stay in , when i booked i was told it was 4 star , this wasnt even a 1 star , it was dirty, over priced (Â£125) it wasnt very safe at all , the draws had handels missing and screws hanging out , i would never reccomend this to anyone , if you ask me it needs closing down ,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worst place on the planet - disgusting”
Reviews.Author: deb_peebles
Reviews.Content: Had to find somewhere quick & cheap for one night because of snow-bound airport in December. Hurriedly found this on Last Minute, WISH we had read reviews first. How on earth did this place get any stars let alone 2? It was unwelcoming, cold, and very basic. The badly spelt notices on front desk should have been a clue! As a family of 5 we had alot of luggage,but had to drag it 2 & 3 storeys up to our rooms (they knew we were a family but still gave us rooms on different floors). Smell hit us first, our children's room stunk of stale smoke & shower/toilet was a heady mix of mould and sewage. Carpets were stained & threadbare, only a bare lightbulb in the rooms. We left immediately, Don't expect to get a refund, guy on front desk wasn't bothered that we were leaving. Dept of Health need to close this place down.

Reviews.Title: “No Wildlife Spotted but Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: pebbles287
Reviews.Content: Sure wish I had found these reviews before booking. We just got back yesterday after spending six nights at this motel. We felt like ditching it as soon as we got there but just managed to spend alot of time away from it. We had a 4th floor (no elevator) triple room with three beds squeezed in, one picture on the wall. One bare lightbulb fixture lit the whole room, no glasses, no shampoo, no chest of drawers, you can't dial out on the phone and there was no phone book (or even bible) shower stall only with water that barely had enough force to rinse hair. Breakfast consisted of cold cereal, toast/jam/butter, hard boiled eggs, cheese, beverages. Be sure not to wear your pajama bottoms down to the breakfast lounge. Lobby consisted of one small sofa about 20' from the reception desk and you must bring your own computer down there to access internet. At least location was okay in terms of catching bus/tube, restaurants nearby, walk to Kensington/Hyde Park and even Piccadilly Square. Surely you can find something better........ there were lots of motels on the same block and one over (hostel is right next door) around this same area whose lobbies looked much better. Wasn't even that inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen in Palace Court Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foto_jo
Reviews.Content: The familyroom was small, as well as the breakfastroom. Some people was not be able to have breakfast. At the last day we leave the suitcase at the reception for a few houres. BIG MISTAKE !! When we came back, suitcase was gone!! Stolen!! Good advice? Avoid this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!”
Reviews.Author: gr8daneEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in this hotel, we each came home with approx 200 bites from bedbugs. It has been awful, we still have bad scarring 2 months later. We have had to fumegate all our 3 households, as we found we had taken the bugs home. It has been both costly and time consuming. I dont think 1 bed bug could have managed this, i think there must have been a true infestation. We have had no response from the hotel at all, but the online booking agent refunded our stay but only after we had to take photograph of all our bites. On top of this the hotel had old carpets etc lying in the corridors and in front of the fire exits, I am wondering if those were from bed-bugs infested rooms. YUCK!! dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all costs”
Reviews.Author: jimbeamgrendel
Reviews.Content: Terrible, terible hotel - Booked through lastminute as just needed a bed for the night at a good rate and this was the cheapest (although still Â£55). Room (B4) was tiny, filthy and noisy - I got to listen to the water pipes all night. The 'shared facilities' means that you stay in the basement and the toilet is three floors above you. No lampshades, a broken mirror, no plug in the sink, stains on the carpet and a telly that couldn't pick up any stations! I don't know when they got their 2 stars but I'm guessing the hotel hasn't been cleaned since. Next time, I'll pay the extra Â£20 for a 'top secret' 4 Star.

Reviews.Title: “Never under any circumstances stay here”
Reviews.Author: Minty63
Reviews.Content: Where to begin - nothing like the pictures and information on their website, rude, ignorant, unhelpful and unfriendly staff, strangers to the concept of customer care. No indication beforehand we would be expected to use debit card to provide Â£20 room deposit (I think, wasn't explained, wouldn't give me the key without it) on top of already having paid for the room, wouldn't accept cash, no explanation. Dingy dirty room with curious 'mezzanine' arrangement on which the double bed was located, I'm 5ft 1 and still constantly banged my head it was so near the ceiling, steep stairs with unsecured rail on one side, difficult to negotiate for some (hotel notified beforehand we had a disabled member of the family). Single bed very hard and uncomfortable. Shower unusable it was so hot, impossible to control the temperature. Toilet didn't flush properly. Saw a mouse run across the room in the evening. Very basic inadequate fire escape and safety information in the room, certainly less than is legally necessary. Mattresses blocking the fire exits next to the 'dining' room in the basement. Generally shabby and unkempt, I could go on, just don't whatever you do stay here, it's an accident waiting to happen and nasty with it.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your marigolds”
Reviews.Author: rfcScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with 4 friends; we got a quad room which was tiny and had a sort of upstairs extension built on; I couldn't stand up straight up straight. Brief inspection showed room was dirty and dated; beds hadn't been changed and mine had crumbs in it. Not a good sign. Limescale all over shower screen and the shower itself was grotty with a dead spider in a web peeking on me as I had a shower. Breakfast was rubbish; would recommend a McDonald's which is a 5 minute walk away. For 1 night it was bearable as we only needed a kip for the night but please spent a bit extra and get a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't find anything cheaper ...”
Reviews.Author: BethCumbria
Reviews.Content: If you really want somewhere just to sleep and are not fussy, go for it! Had a triple room with not much room. Sheets clean but was glad I brought my own antibacterial wipes (after reading reviews!) to clean the bathroom before I would let my daughters use it. Not suitable for romantic getaway. Generally very basic - don't expect too much. Worst thing = lady in charge of breakfast. She spoke to guests like they were school children, proper school ma'am! Brekky is from 7.30-9.30. We arrived at 9.00 only to be told (sorry, ordered) to wait outside coz there were no tables free. She then said we could sit at separate tables. When I said we wanted to sit together, she said that was not a good idea because breakfast finishes at 9.30!! I told her "breakfast finishes when we've had breakfast" which produced a shrug of shoulders. There was also a family of four waiting who agreed with me. We went earlier (8.00) on the other mornings and watched, completely fascinated, how she told guests to hurry up with breakfast coz other guests were waiting!! Whose problem is that?! We were also told to hurry up and go . My reaction? Get another coffee and tell the kids to get more juice. Breakfast itself is plentiful - no complaints there. You get cereal, tea, coffee, orange juice, milk and water, toast and jam, boiled egg, and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “There really is a mouse and it is still there!”
Reviews.Author: Starz044
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the horrible reviews, we decided to still stay and check the hotel out. There was 8 of us and we shared two rooms. At first it was "cute" in its own way. We felt like we were in a dolly house. There was no room for anything so we felt congested. However on the second to last day we saw a mouse run straight across the room! and went back under the bed. We told the receptionist to which we got a "ok we call someone". The next morning one of our members awoke to find rat CRAP under her pillow. Breakfast was not bad however since we stayed there for a week we got turned off of boiled eggs.. (there is noo change! same breakfast every morning!). There was internet which is a plus. Very good area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: MarianaField
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to Bayswater cool area, this is perfect. Close, clean, nice staff and at good price. Rooms are a very small, but are you going to stay in your room?

Reviews.Title: “terrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shakaalis
Reviews.Content: even did not get to go to the hotel because the manager is terrible! rude and incompetent person! don't stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You get better than you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: lornalion
Reviews.Content: This is a very cheap hotel, what can you expect for the price? the room was lovely, and we had ensuite. The staff are friendly to you, if you take the time to be friendly to them too! it's a two-way street! You have to remember that they are foreign and a lot of people are ignorant towards them so they tend to stay quiet! the room was relatively clean, and the breakfast was better than expected! I've paid more for rooms where i've received a bread roll passed off as a 'continental breakfast'. Here, we got a choice of cereal, toast with jams, boiled eggs and cheese also juice and tea/coffee. i stayed with my two young children and my mother and they helped us in every way that they could. We had a place downstairs to store our buggy, as we were on the 4th floor but hey, we got plenty of exercise in the few days we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Westy666
Reviews.Content: Needed a cheap stay in London overnight, so I found a double ensuite room through Lastminute for Â£29. For that sort of money you can't complain - park benches cost more - but it wasn't something I would do again in a hurry. Reception guy was perfectly friendly and trustworthy (why do so many people think that hotels in London are cloning credit cards?) and the hotel was clean and warm - if a bit moth eaten. The room somehow managed to be both clean and grubby. No dirt or mysterious stains, but just a felt a bit 'used' - like sitting on a warm toilet seat.It was a pretty charmless affair - one 100w bulb hanging from the ceiling, cheap furniture, limited storage/hanging space - but the linen was very clean, the telly worked properly and there was tea/coffee facilities. The bathroom was also clean - but stank of drains and boiled cabbage. Didn't feel inclined to take a shower. Breakfast was basic but pretty good and plenty of it if you wanted. Budget travellers could probably 'carb-up' until lunchtime. For Â£29 it was a borderline bargain - but to pay (say)anything over Â£60 for a single room here - let's say you'd do well to shop around and find something better. Definitely not somewhere you'd stay longer than you absolutely had to - which for me was one night.

Reviews.Title: “value for money friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dian1977
Reviews.Content: We are 2 girls from Germany, hotel is hard to find but that is not hotels fault, received big room for 2 of us. good reception. nice worm and clean rooms. recommended for short stay overs for in London.

Reviews.Title: “cost effective and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciN123Australia
Reviews.Content: We are 4 groups of girls from Australia stayed for 5 nights in this hotel and we didnâ€™t faced any problems mentioned in the other reviews. As we travel in peak time our room rate was very high but compared to other awful hotels in London this is far better. I need to comment that reception guys are very friendly not only to us to any friendly guest came to the hotel. (if you nice enough to them) but other staff (housekeeping and breakfast ) not friendly compared to them. As we booked online and pay instantly reception staff they never ask my credit card and only request Â£20 deposit for the room and for key and this normal procedure of all hotels. Hotel is hard to find and that is not hotel fault. And i am wondering about other reviews of card frauds, and if they found that why they didnâ€™t informed to police?? Very funny!!! Finally I would like to say that this cost effective and friendly hotel for shot stay in London..

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gus1982
Reviews.Content: booked through lastminute, and the bloke on the desk kept asking for our credit card because the booking went through. Thank god i knew what he was upto and i showed him my printout, to which he stuttered. ABSOLUTELY SCANDALOUS. Now the room, DREADFUL. toilet stunk of sewage, the room was filthy, and you can hear a rat scratching against the wall at 5am. if this dont put you off then dont know what will except i did catch the reception in the morning on a pornsite!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “descent hotel”
Reviews.Author: johon
Reviews.Content: I am from USA, came to London for Business meeting for five nights. When i am searching a place to stay found this hotel with bit high room price. Me also very concern concerned about some of the reviews such as card cloning. However after my stay in that descent hotel realised that some of the reviews are 100% false. Because the reservation or staff members they canâ€™t access to our card details (if we booked through lastminte.com) I am more than happy with every aspect of the hotel. It is notable that staff is respectable and friendly. Rooms are relatively small but what else we expect heart of London. And me also I like to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: Hampusine
Reviews.Content: Was given the basement room, which smelled mouldy. Box room 3x3m + shower room which smelled even mouldier. Tried to open window to improve conditions, but the window was very hard to open and also, due to staircase outside, it was not really reassuring to keep it open. Also everybody who walked past on the pavement could see the entire room, so we had to keep the curtains closed at all times. One double bed that was propped against the wall to fit. Very hard mattress, and room not really suitable for a parent and child (which we stated when we booked). Several spiders in the shower room, and even one dead on the ceiling of the bedroom. Breakfast was very basic and the little staff we saw were not really friendly; obviously we stopped them doing their job if we asked them something. The reception staff kept changing; I never saw the same man behind the desk twice. This hotel is obviously just there to make money; not to make guests feel wellcome.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: NJH09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (both 21) came down to london for two nights, and were a bit concerned about some of the reviews. However after our stay we were more than happy with every aspect of the hotel. Everything was clean and in working order (the shower took 5 minutes to warm up, but there are worse crimes in the world) and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. This hotel is ideal for people who are on a tight budget or are looking for a quick stop-over (ie travellers from Aussie or the US). The hotel is a little difficult to find as the block, not the road, is called Princes Square, though it is no more than two minutes walk from bayswater station and plenty of shops. There is a night bus that stops by bayswater station too. All-in-all very pleased. If I was to book again, I would probably book a travellodge (or similar) well in advance as looking back it would have been cheaper, however I would still recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: DerbySean
Reviews.Content: Since I had the misfortune to visit this filthy place one thing has been very noticeable. My credit card statement has been growing. The staff have cloned my card and been spend Â£300+ at pizza hut (which is a scam) Â£240 at a tyre and exhaust place and various other things. Luckily my bank has stopped my card and reimbursed me. The staff are theives and crimainals that I will be reporting to the police. PLEASE FIND A PARK BENCH YOU WILL BE SAFER AND MORE COMFORTABLE. YOU HAVE GOT TO BE MAD TO STAY HERE Sean Derby

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: PR0
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel more than a month. It is right rooms are not big, but I am sure that, around that area no one can stay in a better hotel for that price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Thanks to all for that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: Futy
Reviews.Content: We used booking.com which we wonâ€™t use again. Location: Very good easy to get around Building: Unlooked after. You need to be experienced on Mountaineering to get to your room. Room: Very small, havenâ€™t been hovered for a long time. If you drop anything underneath the bed, you will be amazed what you will find there. Keep plastic bags with you all the time, you might throw up anytime. No lampshade but there was any need for, because it blew up in the middle of the evening. Probably wiring is too old. Bed size was fine mattress was terrible. Sockets are located in unreachable corners. There is a TV in the room with no visible channels. There is phone in the room, do not bother using it. We phoned reception no one has answered. We phoned them using our mobile. They answered outside line. We ask for a hair dryer, they said they have it but we had to go 4 floors downstairs to get it. Ok, I donâ€™t mind, I went downstairs; I found two of tem sitting at reception chatting on the net. Bathroom: You need to pump 10 times to flash the toilet. When you open and close the shower door, which is broken, it feels like underground going through the bedroom. When you turn on the shower you might be able to wet yourself but definitely not a shower. There is no strainer in the sink. If u drop you earring, itâ€™s gone. Light did not work above the mirror; I didnâ€™t understand why it was there. Breakfast: Personally I have no complains for breakfast. It was fair enough. Check-out: It was the only pleasure of my stay Only good thing about my stay, my girlfriend was with me. Owners of this place has no knwlodge in this sector.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute Hell Hole!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLeeds
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel!! I read some reviews on the internet and because of my circumstances convinced myself it would be ok. How wrong I was! The room was filthy, dried blood stains on the douvan, no shower door on the shower, no lampshade (apparently this is hotel policy for all rooms!!!!), the walls were filthy, and the filth on a carpet meant I didn't dare put my bare feet down on and it. It felt like a prison cell. There is no sound proofing so you heared every single door slam in the whole hotel all night. After being intimaded by four drunken men in the room next to me at 4am in the morning when they tried hammering my door in and throwing things at my walls, the reception refused to do anything about it and would not call the police, I left after the first night. I had booked for 5 nights. They have so far refused to pay me my money back for the four nights I did not stay!! I am still battling with them over it. Even if you are on a budject as I was - do not take the risk of ignoring the reviews on this site and staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, Bad, Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Laylaj
Reviews.Content: It all seemed ok...but it started with a friend, who's reservation didn't come trhough although he had telephoned and faxed it like they asked. The website is out of date, availability isn't correct, their excuse was that they had just bought the hotel but didn't have the website's password??!! Then we we were put in a room with 3 beds while we reserved 4...then I had to actually show the man that they're were really only 3 beds...The manager came (2 hours later!) Put an extra bed in the room, we were sort of able to walk in the room. TV & Telephone were broken. The second night we found bugs on our pillow...The window couldn't be shut completely. The fire alarm didn't work so why bother going outside for a smoke. Sharing the bathroom went well and we had some nice quiet Italians next to us. The service was terrible it seemed you had to ask and tell everything 4 times before someone would BELIEVE you?! Friends of ours had a rat in the room. We didn't try the breakfast, there was a great Greek on the corner who we did trust preparing our food... The only thing true about the hotel on their website...it's nearby everything. Next time we will spent more money!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room/no clean towels or sheets for a week, dont book here!”
Reviews.Author: haley4089
Reviews.Content: Before leaving this review, I contacted management, and they did not respond. This was my third and final stay at this hotel. The last visit ended me in a basement room, with trash piled up outside the window preventing me from opening the window due to the stench and possible rodents. The location is perfect for me, but there are dozens of hotels in this area that I'm sure do not share these same practices. On my current and final stay at this hotel, house keeping arrived one morning, and attempted to enter the room. I loudly/clearly announced that they would need to return later. She attempted to enter the room anyway, turning the key and pushing on the door. I was not decent, and quickly double locked the door, and again announced she would need to return, and that I was not dressed. She continued to turn the key and push on the door. She advised me my room was her last room. I asked her to leave clean towels outside the door at least. She informed me "management said no more clean towels, and this was not her problem". I was shocked by this statement, and she in fact did not leave clean towels outside the door. For the five days that I stayed at this hotel, the sheets were not changed once, the bed was not made properly (mattress exposed), and the floor was not vacuumed. My luggage was lost, and management refused to check my tracking number with their laptop, that was given to me by the airlines. Two days without clean cloths, or a clean room, so far not a great vacation. The rooms are the size of small closets, and are extremely outdated. I could live with this, but rude service and a filthy room is not acceptable. I was hoping to not have to leave this review, but when I sent this very same message to hotel management, and recvd. no response, I felt others should be forwarned. Nice location, but be prepared for trash outside your window and more of a "camping" experience then a clean hotel room stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Palace Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 64-65 Princess Square, London W2 4PX, England
